title: NASA Statement on Nomination of Bill Nelson for Agency Administrator
content: Acting NASA Administrator Steve Jurczyk released the following statement after today’s nomination by President Joe Biden of Bill Nelson to serve as the 14th NASA administrator:
contentSnippet: Acting NASA Administrator Steve Jurczyk released the following statement after today’s nomination by President Joe Biden of Bill Nelson to serve as the 14th NASA administrator:

title: NASA Mega Moon Rocket Passes Key Test, Readies for Launch
content: The largest rocket element NASA has ever built, the core stage of NASA’s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket, fired its four RS-25 engines for 8 minutes and 19 seconds Thursday at NASA’s Stennis Space Center near Bay St. Louis, Mississippi.
contentSnippet: The largest rocket element NASA has ever built, the core stage of NASA’s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket, fired its four RS-25 engines for 8 minutes and 19 seconds Thursday at NASA’s Stennis Space Center near Bay St. Louis, Mississippi.

title: NASA Joins White House National Climate Task Force
content: As a leading agency observing and understanding environmental changes to Earth, NASA has joined the National Climate Task Force.
contentSnippet: As a leading agency observing and understanding environmental changes to Earth, NASA has joined the National Climate Task Force.

title: NASA, SpaceX Sign Joint Spaceflight Safety Agreement
content: NASA and SpaceX have signed a joint agreement to formalize both parties’ strong interest in the sharing of information to maintain and improve space safety.
contentSnippet: NASA and SpaceX have signed a joint agreement to formalize both parties’ strong interest in the sharing of information to maintain and improve space safety.

title: NASA to Host Briefing to Preview First Mars Helicopter Flights
content: NASA will hold a virtual media briefing at 1:30 p.m. EDT (10:30 a.m. PDT) Tuesday, March 23, to discuss upcoming activities for the agency’s Ingenuity Mars helicopter.
contentSnippet: NASA will hold a virtual media briefing at 1:30 p.m. EDT (10:30 a.m. PDT) Tuesday, March 23, to discuss upcoming activities for the agency’s Ingenuity Mars helicopter.

title: NASA Astronaut Mark Vande Hei Available for Interviews Prior to Launch
content: NASA astronaut Mark Vande Hei will be available Tuesday, March 23, for media interviews prior to his April launch to the International Space Station, which will be his second spaceflight.
contentSnippet: NASA astronaut Mark Vande Hei will be available Tuesday, March 23, for media interviews prior to his April launch to the International Space Station, which will be his second spaceflight.

title: NASA to Host Virtual Symposium Exploring Rise of Commercial Space
content: From activities in low-Earth orbit to NASA’s Artemis program, the commercial space industry has emerged as an innovator in areas of space access, commerce, and exploration.
contentSnippet: From activities in low-Earth orbit to NASA’s Artemis program, the commercial space industry has emerged as an innovator in areas of space access, commerce, and exploration.

title: NASA TV to Air Second Rocket Test for Artemis Moon Missions
content: NASA is targeting a two-hour test window that opens at 3 p.m. EDT Thursday, March 18, for the second hot fire test of the core stage for the agency’s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket at NASA’s Stennis Space Center near Bay St. Louis, Mississippi.
contentSnippet: NASA is targeting a two-hour test window that opens at 3 p.m. EDT Thursday, March 18, for the second hot fire test of the core stage for the agency’s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket at NASA’s Stennis Space Center near Bay St. Louis, Mississippi.

title: NASA Awards Rapid IV On-Ramp 1 Contract for Spacecraft Systems, Services
content: NASA has awarded contracts to Thales Alenia Space France of Cannes, France, and Thales Alenia Space Italia S.p.A. of Rome, Italy, under the On-Ramp feature of the Rapid Spacecraft Acquisition IV (Rapid IV) contract.
contentSnippet: NASA has awarded contracts to Thales Alenia Space France of Cannes, France, and Thales Alenia Space Italia S.p.A. of Rome, Italy, under the On-Ramp feature of the Rapid Spacecraft Acquisition IV (Rapid IV) contract.

title: California Students to Hear from NASA Astronauts Aboard Space Station
content: Students from across California will have an opportunity Thursday, March 18, to hear from NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.
contentSnippet: Students from across California will have an opportunity Thursday, March 18, to hear from NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.
